attributes.action: New rules to be created governing MP’s Pay and Expenses
attributes.additional_details:
MP pay rises should be fixed to the UK rate of inflation. Additionally, all MP expenses should be capped equal to the level of minimum wage (£12675 per annum in 2014).

House of Parliament attendance payment of £150 or £300 to be changed from daily to weekly and capped at £450 or £900, allowing a yearly increase in line with the UK rate of inflation and only paid if a minimum of 5 days (minimum 5 hours per day) are attended.

Any qualifying item(s) that are claimed for can only be paid at the lowest cost; for example: If a pack of cleaning wipes can be bought for £1 and the claim is for £5, then the value of £1 will be paid.
If repeated over-priced claims are applied for (more than 10) from any one claimant, then future claims will be denied.

rejection.details: This is a matter for the House authorities (IPSA) bnot for government
